The APHIS inspector went to the address on file for approved site 001 that is on the Licensee’s account and learned from
the tenant that the Licensee had moved to a different location in May 2023. The APHIS inspector proceeded to the new
address for the site provided by the tenant and spoke with the Licensee. The Licensee stated that she had also moved to
a new location and had a different mailing address than the mailing address that is on file for the account.
Per this Section, licenses are issued to specific persons, and are issued for specific activities, types/numbers of animals,
and for approved sites. A licensee shall notify Animal Care no fewer than 90 days and obtain a new license before any
changes in the name, address, substantial control or ownership of his business/operation, locations, or activities. The
Licensee needs to contact the Animal Care office to inform USDA of the changes in the mailing and site addresses
[general mailbox: animalcare@usda.gov; phone: (970) 494-7478]. Correct by 9/6/24.

Availability of records. At the time of the inspection, the documents/records that are required under the AWA (the written
Program of Veterinary Care, Contingency Plan, Dog Exercise Plan, and the animal records) were unavailable. As a result,
these documents could not be reviewed during the inspection.
Per this Section. all documents and records that are required to be kept under the Animal Welfare Act (AWA) should be
available at the time of an inspection so the documents can be reviewed to determine the facility's compliance with the
provisions of the AWA. Correct from this date 8/28/24 forward.
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with Licensee.

Requirements and application 
The APHIS inspector went to the address on file for approved site 001 that is on the Licensee’s account and learned from 
the tenant that the Licensee had moved to a different location in May 2023. The APHIS inspector proceeded to the new 
address for the site provided by the tenant and spoke with the Licensee. The Licensee stated that she had also moved to 
a new location and had a different mailing address than the mailing address that is on file for the account. 
 
Per this Section, licenses are issued to specific persons, and are issued for specific activities, types/numbers of animals, 
and for approved sites. A licensee shall notify Animal Care no fewer than 90 days and obtain a new license before any 
changes in the name, address, substantial control or ownership of his business/operation, locations, or activities. The 
Licensee needs to contact the Animal Care office to inform USDA of the changes in the mailing and site addresses 
[general mailbox: animalcare@usda.gov; phone: (970) 494-7478]. Correct by 9/6/24. 
2.126(a)(2) 
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
Availability of records. At the time of the inspection, the documents/records that are required under the AWA (the written 
Program of Veterinary Care, Contingency Plan, Dog Exercise Plan, and the animal records) were unavailable. As a result, 
these documents could not be reviewed during the inspection.  
 
Per this Section. all documents and records that are required to be kept under the Animal Welfare Act (AWA) should be 
available at the time of an inspection so the documents can be reviewed to determine the facility's compliance with the 
provisions of the AWA. Correct from this date 8/28/24 forward. 
 
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with Licensee.
